availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Catherine Blain. Father of R.D. Clay Blain, William Blain, Fanny Blain, John Blain, Betsy Blain, and Kate Blain. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1850 and in 1860. Owned 12 enslaved persons in 1860

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District no. 1, p. 58. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District no. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 123-124. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 33.
